intents.name: FAQ_TEN
sampleUtterances: How can I Improve my credit score
What should I do to improve my credit score

messages.content: There are numerous ways you can improve your credit score. Generally speaking the best ways to maintain and improve your credit score are to avoid late payments on your bills, make any loan or other credit/finance payments on time, pay off any defaults or catch up on any late payments, and avoid applying for credit several times in a short space of time

intents.name: FAQ_THREE
sampleUtterances: Why isn't the website showing properly in my browser
The website is not working in my browser

messages.content:
To provide you with the best user experience, we have designed Credit Savvy to function with the most recent versions of popular browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer, and Safari.

If you are experiencing issues then please update your browser to the latest version. If this doesn't solve the problem then do let us know.

intents.name: FAQ_SEVEN
sampleUtterances: Why do you need my personal details
How safe is my personal details

messages.content: We need your personal details to ensure we can access the correct information and get your credit score, while ensuring it is indeed your information that were checking and not someone elses. We check your identity with Equifax to confirm the ID documents you have provided, and match up your details to provide you with your tailored interest rate. Your personal details are completely safe with us

intents.name: FAQ_TWO
sampleUtterances: Does everyone have a credit history
Do I need to have credit history

messages.content: If you have never applied or had any form of credit in the past, you probably wont have a credit score, although the majority of people do. It is common for those under 18 not to have a credit score as they would have needed to have had a credit card, personal loan, or a utility account in their name, which they wouldnt normally get until they leave home or in some cases  as with some personal loans  they would not be eligible until turning 21.

intents.name: FAQ_EIGHT
sampleUtterances: How can I get my credit report
How can I access my credit report

messages.content: You have the right to request access to your credit score free of charge. To do this, all you need to do is get in touch with one of Australias three credit reporting bureaus. These are Equifax (formally Veda), Experian, and D&B. At NOW FINANCE, we generate your credit score and process personal loan applications based on the information held by Equifax, although it is worth checking what information is held by all of the credit bureaus with any future credit applications with other lenders in mind

Hey
Hi

messages.content: Hi I am FinanceBot and Can I know your name ?

intents.name: FAQ_FIVE
sampleUtterances: Why is the interest rate higher than what your competitors are offering
Why is the interest rate higher

messages.content: We offer loan applicants a personalisedinterest rate prior to completing the application, with no obligation to proceed. As a result, our rates do not change throughout the process; the rate you get is the rate you will be offered if your personal loan application is accepted

intents.name: FAQ_ONE
sampleUtterances: Does it cost to get my credit score or credit report
Do I have to pay to get my credit score or credit report
how much does it cost to get my credit score or credit report

messages.content: No, you can get your credit score here at NOW FINANCE completely free, along with your personalised interest rate for your personal loan. To get your credit report, you can request access from one of Australias three credit reporting bureaus, which are Equifax, Experian, and D&B, and they will send you a free report.

intents.name: FAQ_FOUR
sampleUtterances: Why is my account not verifed
Why my account is not verified
How long does it take to verify the account

messages.content: If you continually get our standard 16.95% interest rate and we cannot match you with the credit bureau, this means that either: 1) the details you have entered are incorrect, 2) the credit bureau does not hold your details, 3) we are unable to verify you based on the information you have provided.

intents.name: FAQ_NINE
sampleUtterances: I don't agree with your credit score what can I do
I need to talk about the credit score

messages.content: NOW FINANCE receive your credit score once you have completed an application. You can complete the Get My Rate to see what your credit score is before you apply. If you disagree with your credit score, you can get in touch with a credit reporting bureau to request access to your credit file.

intents.name: FAQ_SIX
sampleUtterances: When will I get access to my official credit report
How do I get access for my credit report

messages.content: We are unable to provide you with a copy of your credit report. You can get a copy of your credit report and credit score by asking a credit bureau. The three credit bureaus in Australia are Equifax (formally Veda), Experian, and D&B

intents.name: FAQ_NNEKL
sampleUtterances: Does it cost to get my credit score or credit report

messages.content: No, you can get your credit score here at NOW FINANCE completely free, along with your personalised interest rate for your personal loan. To get your credit report, you can request access from one of Australia’s three credit reporting bureaus, which are Equifax, Experian, and D&B, and they will send you a free report.

intents.name: FAQ_WORjn
sampleUtterances: Does everyone have a credit history

messages.content: If you have never applied or had any form of credit in the past, you probably won’t have a credit score, although the majority of people do. It is common for those under 18 not to have a credit score as they would have needed to have had a credit card, personal loan, or a utility account in their name, which they wouldn’t normally get until they leave home or in some cases – as with some personal loans – they would not be eligible until turning 21.

intents.name: FAQ_lZGEx
sampleUtterances: Why isnt the website showing properly in my browser

messages.content:
To provide you with the best user experience, we have designed Credit Savvy to function with the most recent versions of popular browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer, and Safari.

If you are experiencing issues then please update your browser to the latest version. If this doesn't solve the problem then do let us know.

If you are stuck with a non-compatible browser at work (we all know how this feels), then you can always try using your smartphone or other device as Credit Savvy also been designed to work across most mobile devices and browsers.

intents.name: FAQ_tGlWC
sampleUtterances: Why cant you verify me

messages.content: If you continually get our standard 16.95% interest rate and we cannot match you with the credit bureau, this means that either: 1) the details you have entered are incorrect, 2) the credit bureau does not hold your details, 3) we are unable to verify you based on the information you have provided. We are unable to provide credit scores to people who we are unable to identify and verify. Sometimes, we will be unable to verify your identity due to mismatches between your identity information and what is checked. In these cases, unless you are able to submit another identity document, you will be unable to obtain your credit score with NOW FINANCE. If you believe the information held on you to be incorrect then you should contact the relevant credit bureau. For security reasons we limit the number of identity verification attempts per person before we lock further access, in order to safeguard both ourselves and consumers against fraud.

intents.name: FAQ_fLDpj
sampleUtterances: Why is my interest rate higher than what your competitors are offering

messages.content: At NOW FINANCE, we offer loan applicants a personalized interest rate prior to completing the application, with no obligation to proceed. As a result, our rates do not change throughout the process; the rate you get is the rate you will be offered if your personal loan application is accepted. NOW FINANCE will help you avoid surprises post-application.

intents.name: FAQ_nCrzw
sampleUtterances: Can you give me access to my official credit report

messages.content: We are unable to provide you with a copy of your credit report.  You can get a copy of your credit report and credit score by asking a credit bureau. The three credit bureaus in Australia are Equifax (formally Veda), Experian, and D&B. Different bureaus may return different information and credit scores, as each collect different information and generate credit scores differently. NOW FINANCE uses Equifax to obtain a copy of your credit report.  You can request a copy of your credit report directly from one of the credit reporting bureaus.

intents.name: FAQ_zasJg
sampleUtterances: Why do you need my personal details and how safe are they

messages.content: We need your personal details to ensure we can access the correct information and get your credit score, while ensuring it is indeed your information that we’re checking and not someone else’s. We check your identity with Equifax to confirm the ID documents you have provided, and match up your details to provide you with your tailored interest rate. Your personal details are completely safe with us, and you can read more about how we protect your details and data in our Privacy Policy and our Terms and Conditions.

intents.name: FAQ_cdemx
sampleUtterances: How can I get my credit report

messages.content: You have the right to request access to your credit score free of charge. To do this, all you need to do is get in touch with one of Australia’s three credit reporting bureaus. These are Equifax (formally Veda), Experian, and D&B. At NOW FINANCE, we generate your credit score and process personal loan applications based on the information held by Equifax, although it is worth checking what information is held by all of the credit bureaus with any future credit applications with other lenders in mind.

intents.name: FAQ_ABOdm
sampleUtterances: I dont agree with your credit score what can I do

messages.content: NOW FINANCE receive your credit score once you have completed an application.  You can complete the Get My Rate to see what your credit score is before you apply.  If you disagree with your credit score, you can get in touch with a credit reporting bureau to request access to your credit file. From here you can check that all the information held on your file is correct and request corrections where necessary. NOW FINANCE uses Equifax (formally Veda) to generate your score and check your profile, so if you are looking to proceed with an application for one of our loans, we recommend getting a copy of your credit report direct from Equifax and checking what information is held.

intents.name: FAQ_vvYjV
sampleUtterances: How can I Improve my credit score

messages.content: There are numerous ways you can improve your credit score. Generally speaking the best ways to maintain and improve your credit score are to avoid late payments on your bills, make any loan or other credit/finance payments on time, pay off any defaults or catch up on any late payments, and avoid applying for credit several times in a short space of time. You can request access to your credit score free, or take out a subscription to be able to always monitor your score. If any incorrect information is held on your credit report, you can request this is corrected.

intents.name: FAQ_cAxqC
sampleUtterances: Why is my credit score different to my report

messages.content: There are three credit bureaus in Australia: Equifax/Veda, Experian, and D&B. Each of these credit bureaus obtains different information for each individual and calculates credit risk in different ways to give an overall picture of whether a lender may want to accept your credit application. Your credit score may therefore change depending on which credit bureau you have used to access your score and file. In addition, your credit score is constantly updating and evolving depending on your circumstances and financial behaviour, including when you pay off a credit card in full or maintain your monthly payments on your phone bill. As each credit bureau calculates your credit score differently you may find your score fluctuates to different degrees with different credit bureaus depending on your circumstances and financial behaviour.

intents.name: FAQ_rXTIl
sampleUtterances: Why do you need my drivers licence or passport details

messages.content: We need your driver’s license or passport details so we can verify your identity and access your credit report and credit score. Without seeing these documents we are unable to match you to your credit file, therefore will be unable to give you your interest rate or assess your personal loan application. Verifying these documents also ensures we are checking the right person’s credit report, can provide an interest rate and loan decision based on the correct person’s details, and safeguards you from identity theft and other types of fraud.

intents.name: FAQ_CKyqn
sampleUtterances: Why do you need my personal details to get an interest rate

messages.content: We need your personal details so that we can identify you against your ID and then access your credit report and credit score and ensure we are looking at the correct person’s details. There have been cases in the past of people reporting they had been turned down for credit with various lenders because someone with the same or a similar name lived in the same apartment block, so it is important we have all the information we need. Without your personal details we would be unable to match you to the correct credit file and therefore would not be able to give you your interest rate in advance or a decision on a personal loan application. Checking your personal details also safeguards you from identity theft.

intents.name: FAQ_EsGzU
sampleUtterances: Does applying for a loan impact my credit score

messages.content: Every personal loan application – and every application you make for credit – impacts your credit score.

intents.name: FAQ_PDsIa
sampleUtterances: Do you offer loans for home ownership deposits

messages.content: No, NOW FINANCE does not offer personal loans to be used as deposits towards buying a home or any other type of property.

intents.name: FAQ_cFuTV
sampleUtterances: How do I find out what my personal loan balance is

messages.content: To find out your personal loan balance, simply give your personal loan advisor a call so we can assist you further.

intents.name: FAQ_zBFpd
sampleUtterances: Do I get instant approval for a Personal Loan

messages.content: We don’t offer instant approval for personal loans, as we abide by the Responsible Lending Guidelines. We’ll need to see your documentation once your application is received and will be in touch to let you know exactly what supporting documents we need. The sooner we have all the documentation we need to determine if a loan is suitable, the quicker you will have an answer from us.

intents.name: FAQ_mKWgd
sampleUtterances: How long before I get the money

messages.content: Assuming we have all the supporting documentation we need to assess your loan suitability following an approval or conditional approval, we may have the funds in your bank account within 2 hours of final approval. This time frame may change for each individual.

intents.name: FAQ_PHvHS
sampleUtterances: Can I apply if I am in a Part  Debt Agreement

messages.content: If you are currently in a Part IX Debt Agreement we are unable to process your loan application.

intents.name: FAQ_ypnzi
sampleUtterances: Why do you need my employers details

messages.content: We will contact your employer to verify your employment status, and conduct employment checks on new customers. We are very discrete and never divulge personal information or any information on the nature of the call.

intents.name: FAQ_MEhAp
sampleUtterances: How do I receive the money once my personal loan has been approved

messages.content: As part of the loan application process, you can nominate if you want your loan disbursement paid to a nominated bank account or paid directly to the suppliers invoice. Once your personal loan application has been received, we aim to give you an initial decision within 24 hours. If your loan application is accepted or you receive a conditional offer, we aim for the time from application to loan settlement to be no more than 72 hours.

intents.name: FAQ_KozoG
sampleUtterances: Can I take out a personal loan for business purposes

messages.content: No. A NOW FINANCE personal loan may not be used for business or business related purposes, including working capital.

intents.name: FAQ_Onvtr
sampleUtterances: Can I make extra payments or repay my loan early

messages.content: Yes, you can make extra repayments to your account and repay your loan early at any time. Currently, there is a $175 early termination fee if you repay your personal loan in full within the first six months, and a $120 early termination fee if you repay your loan in the first 12 months. After 12 months, no early termination fee applies. There are no fees to make additional payments or to increase your regular direct debit payment.

intents.name: FAQ_zNoYx
sampleUtterances: How fast is the application process

messages.content: Completing your personal loan application will take no more than 15 - 20 minutes. You can complete your personal loan application online, or give us a call to go through the application with one of our personal loan experts.

intents.name: FAQ_SBmlr
sampleUtterances: What do I do if I cannot make a payment

messages.content: The best thing to do is to call NOW FINANCE  about your current situation and changes which may have occurred.  We will provide you with all hardship options that are available. This is the best option, as there will likely be a range of solutions available and ways that we can help you. Give us a call and let's work through this together and find out how we can help, rather than missing a payment and us then chasing you.

intents.name: FAQ_jjHLB
sampleUtterances: Are there any establishment fees

messages.content: Yes, there is an application fee for a NOW FINANCE personal loan. What this amount is will depend on the loan amount.  The NOW FINANCE Personal Loan Advisors will notify you of all fees and charges during application process.

intents.name: FAQ_NaqXl
sampleUtterances: Can I check my account balance online

messages.content: At the moment, there is no facility to check your account balance online. However, if you call us and speak to your personal loan advisor they will be able to provide you with an up to date account balance whenever you require.

intents.name: FAQ_JQFqk
sampleUtterances: Can you send documents via the postal system

messages.content: No. All applicants need to have an email address when they apply and documents can be faxed or emailed to us.

intents.name: FAQ_DGoHN
sampleUtterances: Do you have a branch that we can visit

messages.content: No, we don't have a branch. All communication is done via email, phone, and virtually to make the loan application and management process as simple as possible. We provide our personal customer service over the phone, and when you have a personal loan with us you will always speak to the same person when you call us.

intents.name: FAQ_zyWOY
sampleUtterances: Do you do loans for people who have been bankrupt

messages.content: No, we do not offer personal loans to individuals who have been declared bankrupt as part of our eligibility criteria.

intents.name: FAQ_HBkzM
sampleUtterances: Do you do credit checks

messages.content: We do credit checks for all personal loan applications. As a responsible lender we adhere to the Responsible Lending Guidelines. We will assess your personal loan application and your current financial situation based on a variety of factors.  Your credit score makes up one component of the assessment criteria.

intents.name: FAQ_XDChT
sampleUtterances: Can I have a guarantor on the personal loan

messages.content: No. We do not offer personal loans with a guarantor.

intents.name: FAQ_IUHmf
sampleUtterances: Do you do joint loans

messages.content: No, we only accept personal loan applications from individuals.

intents.name: FAQ_hhhxV
sampleUtterances: What documents will you need from me

messages.content: All of our personal loan applicants are required to have an acceptable form of ID. The ID we require is either an Australian passport (valid or expired within the last 24 months) or a current Australian drivers license and Medicare card. Depending on the outcome of your personal loan application, we may ask to see some additional documentation. What we ask for is different for each application, however to speed up the process it is worth ensuring you have the following to hand: Front & Back of your ID documents, Proof of employment and income, Details of your existing credit commitments, Proof of address, Details of your rent/mortgage payments, Bank statements.

intents.name: FAQ_nQjoj
sampleUtterances: What happens after I have applied

messages.content: After your application is received, it will be sent to our credit team who will either approve, conditionally approve or decline your application. If declined, unfortunately we are unable to off you a personal loan at this time. If your personal loan application is conditionally approved, you will need to send us some additional information to enable us to settle the loan and provide you with the funds. This additional information may include your most recent payslip, your last year's PAYG summary, the front and back of the ID you have used in your application, and the front page of your bank statement, although each conditional loan offer and the documents we need will be specific to each applicant.  We may request more information depending on your financial situation.

intents.name: FAQ_mmjnw
sampleUtterances: Do you offer loans for people on Centrelink benefits

messages.content: Yes, although you will also need to be working as we can accept Centrelink benefits as a secondary income source for assessing your financial situation and the affordability of the personal loan you have applied for.

intents.name: FAQ_AcyvV
sampleUtterances: Do you do loans for people on a disability pension

messages.content: Unfortunately, we don't do loans for people on a disability pension as this doesn't meet our eligibility criteria.

intents.name: FAQ_Mhzoz
sampleUtterances: Do you do loans for people with bad credit

messages.content: We do not offer a specific personal loan for people with bad credit. As a responsible lender, we conduct a credit rating check as well as a manual assessment of your credit file. We base our decision whether to accept or decline your application on both your credit history and your current financial situation. If your current credit score and history means you would be unlikely to be accepted, we recommend you read our blog to learn some great tips for improving your credit score and tidying up your credit file.

intents.name: FAQ_ZDzdN
sampleUtterances: What are your exit fees

messages.content: Our early exit fees are $175 if you repay your loan in the first six months, and $120 if you repay your loan in the first 12 months. No early exit fees apply should you repay your loan in full after the first 12 months.

intents.name: FAQ_fGUFw
sampleUtterances: How Long will the application take

messages.content: Our personal loan application process takes 15-20 minutes to complete. We aim to have a conditional answer for all applicants within 24 hours. Once the loan is conditionally approved the length of the process depends on how quickly you return the supporting information we request in addition to your identification documents.

intents.name: FAQ_DqyjZ
sampleUtterances: Can I Apply Online

messages.content: Yes, we now have an online application form. You can either apply for your NOW FINANCE personal loan online after getting your interest rate, or you can request a call back from one of our personal loan experts to complete your application over the phone.

intents.name: FAQ_HuXPe
sampleUtterances: Do you need to provide security for a personal loan

messages.content: You only need to provide security for a personal loan if you are taking out a secured personal loan.  An unsecured loan does not require security.

intents.name: FAQ_cBjHG
sampleUtterances: Whats a comparison rate

messages.content: A comparison rate helps you to identify the true cost of your personal loan. The comparison rate includes the base interest rate, as well as any loan fees and charges, to give you a single percentage rate that you can use to assess loans from different providers. Ensure you use the comparison rate as your benchmark when shopping around for personal loans, and avoid choosing a specific provider based purely on the base interest rate as you may not know what additional costs and fees you will be subject to.

intents.name: FAQ_BzTiU
sampleUtterances: Whats the difference between a secured loan and unsecured loan

messages.content: A secured loan is secured against an asset that you own. This will be your car or other vehicle that can be registered as security against the loan. When you take out a secured loan you are using this asset as collateral should you fail to meet your loan repayments. For example, should you default on your secured loan repayments, as part of the agreement your loan provider may take possession of the security you offered before signing the contract. Due to these loans being secured against assets, consumers can often borrow more at a lower interest rate in comparison to an unsecured loan. An unsecured loan is simply a personal loan that is not secured against an asset. Unsecured loans are usually offered at lower borrowing amounts and with a higher interest rate.

intents.name: FAQ_yyIJK
sampleUtterances: I want to pay out my loan in full Can I do this

messages.content: You may be able to repay your loan in full, but it is important to contact your lender to obtain a final payout figure. You may incur break costs on top of other fees and charges. If you think you may be in a position to repay your loan in full early before you apply, you should check what your position would be with specific lenders before applying for and accepting a personal loan.

intents.name: FAQ_bZbZu
sampleUtterances: How do I make my loan repayments on time

messages.content: There are two steps to making sure you make all your personal loan repayments on time. The first is to set up a direct debit to ensure your personal loan provider can take the repayments from your bank account at the agreed intervals. If you take out a personal loan with NOW FINANCE, this will be on a weekly or a fortnightly basis. The second step is to manage your finances to ensure that your funds will be in the bank so that the payments can be taken. If your financial circumstances change at any point during your loan term, you should speak to your personal loan provider, who will discuss your options with you. If you need to do something as simple as change the day your direct debit payment is taken, this shouldn’t be a problem for most personal loan providers.

intents.name: FAQ_SfDbX
sampleUtterances: Do I have to pay the application fee before I apply for the loan

messages.content: NOW FINANCE will not charge you an upfront fee prior to applying for a personal loan. An application fee will be charged once your application has been accepted and built into your loan repayments. You will have visibility of all fees and charges prior to accepting the loan offer.

intents.name: FAQ_dlwEH
sampleUtterances: is debt consolidation the same as being bankrupt

messages.content: No, consolidating your debts is not the same as being bankrupt. Debt consolidation is the practice of using a new personal loan, or another product, to pay all of your current debts, thus consolidating your debt commitments to one place. Bankruptcy is when a consumer cannot meet their debt obligations and files a debtors petition with the Australian Financial Security Authority to be declared bankrupt, or when creditors whom are owed at least $5,000 file a creditors petition in a court, having been unable to come to another form of debt settlement.

intents.name: FAQ_IwwLW
sampleUtterances: is debt consolidation the same as debt negotiation

messages.content: No, they are two different things. Debt consolidation is when you take out a new personal loan or another credit product and consolidate all your existing debts into one. Debt negotiation involves speaking to your creditors in order to come to a mutually acceptable agreement. Creditors will offer financial hardship solutions to assist you in the first instance.

intents.name: FAQ_ouzsH
sampleUtterances: How do I make loan repayments

messages.content: You make your regular personal loan repayments via direct debit under the repayment terms agreed with your personal loan provider. With NOW FINANCE, you have the option to choose weekly or fortnightly personal loan repayments based on what is best for your own personal circumstances. As well as making your regular personal  loan repayments you may also have the option to make additional payments, although depending on your loan provider these extra payments may be subject to fees if they change your regular repayment or the structure of your loan.

intents.name: FAQ_MxIFA
sampleUtterances: How do I make loan repayments

messages.content: You make your regular personal loan repayments via direct debit under the repayment terms agreed with your personal loan provider. With NOW FINANCE, you have the option to choose weekly or fortnightly personal loan repayments based on what is best for your own personal circumstances. As well as making your regular personal  loan repayments you may also have the option to make additional payments, although depending on your loan provider these extra payments may be subject to fees if they change your regular repayment or the structure of your loan.

intents.name: FAQ_DgMaL
sampleUtterances: Why might I be offered a different loan amount to my application

messages.content: Upon receiving your personal loan application and reviewing your credit score and history, your personal loan provider will assess your application based on many things.  Primarily the loan provider will ensure that their product will meet your needs and objectives and to ensure you have the ability to be able to repay the loan committment without any undue hardship.  The loan provider may offer you a loan for a different amount and for this to happen, the provider must be satisfied that you are able to repay the loan. Based on your personal circumstances your loan provider may therefore offer you a personal loan at a lower amount that they believe is affordable to you.

intents.name: FAQ_DhpaW
sampleUtterances: Why do I need to provide my bank details for a personal loan

messages.content: You need to provide your bank details so we know where to send the loan once we have verified your account upon receiving your bank statements. We also need your bank details so we can set up a direct debit payment to ensure your repayments on your NOW FINANCE personal loan are made weekly or fortnightly, depending on the frequency you have chosen for your loan.

intents.name: FAQ_UzDAW
sampleUtterances: Why do I need to provide my bank statements for a personal loan

messages.content: Primarily the reason why we need your bank statements is to verify that the account where we’ll be paying the money is indeed your bank account. In addition, depending on the conditions of your personal loan offer, we may ask to see your last 90 days of bank statements to help us better assess the affordability of the loan you have applied for, your capacity to repay the loan, and as an additional means of verifying your income and general living expenses.

intents.name: FAQ_SUoOX
sampleUtterances: Are thre any credit checks involved for a personal loan

messages.content: Yes. When you apply for a personal loan, as a minimum a personal loan company will look at your credit score. At NOW FINANCE, when you apply for a personal loan or request your credit rate before proceeding to an application, as well as looking at your credit score, one of our personal loan experts looks at your wider credit history to help us make a decision about your personal loan. Given the checks that are conducted when you apply for a personal loan, it is strongly recommended that you take the time to check your credit file is correct prior to making an application.

intents.name: FAQ_lzEEL
sampleUtterances: What can I use a personal loan for

messages.content: With NOW FINANCE, you can use your personal loan for a wide range of purposes, including debt consolidation, to cover the cost of medical, dental, or education bills, to cover travel costs, to pay for a new vehicle or for vehicle repairs, for home improvements, or to help pay for a wedding.

intents.name: FAQ_eMpUU
sampleUtterances: Whats the difference between variable and fixed interest rates

messages.content: When you are looking for a personal loan you might find yourself looking at a choice between variable and fixed interest rate loans. With a fixed rate personal loan, you get your interest rate when you take out your loan, and this is fixed for the loan term. This means that the full amount repayable as well as your regular repayment will always be fixed. With a variable rate interest loan, the interest rate on your loan is subject to change depending on the Reserve Bank of Australia’s cash rate, meaning that your full amount repayable as well as your regular repayment could go up or down during your loan term.

intents.name: FAQ_PyVGQ
sampleUtterances: Whats the difference between variable and fixed interest rates

messages.content: When you are looking for a personal loan you might find yourself looking at a choice between variable and fixed interest rate loans. With a fixed rate personal loan, you get your interest rate when you take out your loan, and this is fixed for the loan term. This means that the full amount repayable as well as your regular repayment will always be fixed. With a variable rate interest loan, the interest rate on your loan is subject to change depending on the Reserve Bank of Australia’s cash rate, meaning that your full amount repayable as well as your regular repayment could go up or down during your loan term.

intents.name: FAQ_OrOmw
sampleUtterances: How often can I make repayments on a personal loan

messages.content: The frequency you can make repayments on your personal loan will depend on your specific provider. When you take out a personal loan with NOW FINANCE, you have the choice of choosing weekly or fortnightly repayments depending on what works for you.

intents.name: FAQ_myZtY
sampleUtterances: What additional fees should I look for with personal loans

messages.content: When applying for a personal loan there are a number of fees you should look for. First, look for any loan fees that are not built into the actual comparison rate and when these will become payable. It is also worth looking out for what loan fees would apply if you wanted to make additional repayments against your personal loan or repay your loan in full early. You should also consider what late payment fees apply to your loan should you miss a payment, and discover whether there are any other administration fees that may become payable during your loan term.

intents.name: FAQ_oaKvE
sampleUtterances: Should I only be interested in the interest rate of a personal loan

messages.content: While the interest rate of a personal loan is often the headline in any advertising, and is designed to get you to apply, it isn’t all you should consider even if it is the most important factor in your decision. In addition to considering the interest rate of the loan, look into what loan fees apply, whether you will be able to repay the loan early if you want to, what types of loan are available, and what regular repayment options are open to you. You should also think about the customer service levels different personal loan providers offer and take the time to look at online reviews.

intents.name: FAQ_vJQGJ
sampleUtterances: Can personal loan companies see all my previous credit history

messages.content: It depends on your age and how much of a credit history you have, though generally personal loan companies will be able to see information relating to your financial behaviour and use of credit products. When checking your credit history, personal loan companies can see information including any credit cards, personal loans, home loans, credit limits, as well as any information related to any defaults, court judgments, or bankruptcies that you have been subject to.

intents.name: FAQ_rIqMN
sampleUtterances: If I apply for a loan will it affect my credit rating

messages.content: Applying for one personal loan in isolation will still affect your credit rating. Lenders check your file themselves rather than solely relying on your credit score and seeing repeated applications may be an indicator of underlying financial problems and lead to your application being declined. With NOW FINANCE you can get your interest rate before applying for a personal loan without affecting your credit rating.

intents.name: FAQ_nWkss
sampleUtterances: Will multiple credit enquiries impact my ability to be approved for a personal loan

messages.content: If you apply for multiple personal loans or other types of credit in a short space of time, then this may affect your ability to be approved for a personal loan. If you are looking for a personal loan and decide to apply for numerous personal loans at once, this will affect your ability to be approved, as lenders will look at your credit file and see these repeat applications. Lenders see repeat applications as a consumer having an urgent need for credit, and this can act as a red flag leading to loan applications being declined.

intents.name: FAQ_KlysG
sampleUtterances: Should I apply to multiple personal loan companies to get the best interest rate

messages.content: No. Each time you apply for a personal loan, not only does a credit provider run a credit check, but that credit search is logged on your credit file. Applying for many different personal loans in a short period is likely to lead to you being offered increasingly higher interest rates and potentially your applications being declined. Instead of shopping around for personal loans by applying for several at once, do your research prior to applying, including checking your credit file is correct, and only apply for one loan. At NOW FINANCE you can get your interest rate before applying for a personal loan without affecting your credit score.

intents.name: FAQ_DCURP
sampleUtterances: I have been previously bankrupt am I eligible for a personal loan

messages.content: NOW FINANCE does not accept personal loan applications from individual who have previously been declared bankrupt. There are some personal loan providers that do provide loans under these circumstances, however these are often short term and payday loans with a high interest rate. Given your previous bankruptcy you should consider whether taking out a personal loan or any other credit product is the right step for you to take.

intents.name: FAQ_sywzj
sampleUtterances: I have been previously bankrupt am I eligible for a personal loan

messages.content: NOW FINANCE does not accept personal loan applications from individual who have previously been declared bankrupt. There are some personal loan providers that do provide loans under these circumstances, however these are often short term and payday loans with a high interest rate. Given your previous bankruptcy you should consider whether taking out a personal loan or any other credit product is the right step for you to take.

intents.name: FAQ_qTaCN
sampleUtterances: Personal loan companies advertise at low rates is that the interest I will receive

messages.content: Not necessarily. Some personal loan companies will often advertise a low interest rate to make a loan seem attractive and to tempt you to apply, however when you receive your loan offer the interest rate you receive may be far higher than the one on the advert. Personal loan companies are required by law to show the comparison rate if they show an interest rate on any advertising or marketing.  So look out for this if applying for a loan online, and remember with NOW FINANCE you can get your interest rate before you proceed to an application with no impact on your credit score.
